_header: Thou most sweetest of any thing
Title(s): A Songe of Loue to oure Lord Iesu Criste
Subjects: love, toward Jesus; Christ, love toward
_description: ‘A Songe of Loue to oure Lord Iesu Criste’ — 69 monorhyming quatrains

Dod.First Lines: Thou most swettest of any thynge…
Dod.Editions:
“Ancient English Poems: from a Manuscript Belonging to J. W. Dod, Esq.
                of Cloverley, M.P. for the Northern Division of Salop.” 
             Gentleman’s Magazine
         n.s. 29 (June 1848): 612-14.
